9KYZVKGgbEbe8A7b0v0ZGQ.text: I love this place, the servers are nice and attentive. Their chicken wings are the bomb with several choices of flavors.  I ordered Cuban Sandwich on their lunch special menu and they are great! But I was wondering why it's not pressed. Other than that this place is highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Cuban sandwich

PCI78BF4Ld19cOm0fQ22Fw.text: Hanging out with friends, we came because one friend had raved about the donut burger.  Well surprise surprise I didnt try it because there were so many other things on the menu that were enticing.  What I wanted most was the reese cup dessert so I didnt want to fill up on anything else.  Our server helped me decide on a few wings (lots of flavors).  I stole a few sweet potato tater tots with dipping sauce from a friend (so yummy).  Our server was very accommodating and  I hate I don't remember her name but if I do I will surely edit this review because she was great. We happened to be there when they started trivia and played 3 rounds.  Very fun night with friends, good food and good service.  We've already vowed the next time we go back the focus will be dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States
Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Garlic Parmesan wings
Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Reese cup dessert

6Abm-iAkRscVQ5Wo6kTehA.text: Food was delicious and the service was excellent. We got a table right away and drinks too. Our appetizer was great (mozzarella sticks) and so were the giant burgers. We got the Mac and cheese chili burger and the donut burger. We could not eat all the burgers and the generous helping of fries.   Great spot when in Mint Hill

photos.caption: Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Mac and cheese chili burger
Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Mac and cheese chili burger w/fries
Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Mac and cheese chili burger

JX03smVBzue8bE0YloZzcw.text: What took me so long to try this place? This is one of those rare restaurant bars that everyone in the family was happy with. My five-year-old, my preteens, the wife and me. Have a nice menu with a variety of options, great daily drink specials, friendly servers, and more. This place really hits all spots. If there is any negative, it's that it's a popular place, and if you get there later in the evening you're probably going to wait for a table. My family can't wait to return.

uVhXwyFGV7l_6bnPQ_y3Fw.text: Smiles all around, friendly service, family friendly atmosphere, good food at a solid value, overall definitely a place I would visit again if I am ever out that way.

7vSgHL_84QAWLHVNYbtAlw.text: Love Dunwellz for their bowl and cup of chili, actually my opinion it's the best chili I've had in the area. You'll find they have pretty good tacos great hamburgers love the crispy fries in the condiments. You can get great salads with a burger on the salad instead of bread really never had a bad dish here. The staff is great, service is wonderful and the speed to table is very good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States
Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States
Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States

vDKVjWvx2v4RKh5HYlsJng.text: Enjoyed the $.60 wings this evening.  We tried a few of their sauces. I enjoyed the kickin bourbon and the bbq.  I also liked the $1.50 pabst on tap!  The bartender was nice and provided good service.  The bar was pretty busy and the I enjoyed the televisions.  Not really sure about the music that was playing but an overall nice experience.

I6ehmxu52mOYFlas4q1Pqw.text: Fantastic burger made any way you want, and I mean ANY way. Choose everything from the bread to the mayo. The southwestern spring rolls are fantastic with a chipotle dipping sauce. I don't care much for a sports bar based restaurant, but the food is so good I'll be frequent flyer. 1st trip I got my burger on a bun, 2nd trip on texas toast. Both excellent. I'm not sure I'm ready to try a burger on a donut, but the waitress said it was good. Both trips we had very friendly and attentive waitresses.

dAZbBkBojvqcjifKD_TSEw.text: My wife and I go here weekly. Best beer selection in Mint Hill, burgers are good (not great) but building options are amazing. All the other food ( wings, fish N chips, nachos, standard pub fare) are awesome, and the beer prices are perfect.

oe5wg6LTk2fpWDAQSnJq7Q.text: Have been there several times in the past, food is always great. The po boy sandwich is killer. Since it's a smaller place it fills up quickly in the evenings, just a tip for ya.

zoAO95veLmePRFygP5Yffg.text: drink special every night.  not your typical food choices. the notorious P.I.G. is damn good, its a burger- pulled pork- bacon topped with onion straws. wings here too. decent choice of deserts and an outdoor patio.

dNlg-NBNES_M2YaROYrtLw.text: This place is great.  The food is good (not overpriced), and I have had to get a to go box both times I have been in. I don't see how people say the portions are small. The beers on tap are just what Mint Hill needed, good local craft brewer (no nascar beer). The owners care about what the customers want from what I have noticed. Unlike other places around Mint Hill. I do not enjoy country music either, but the good thing is they have an online juke box.  Overall this place is good and I think they will continue to get better. I would recommend the wings and a cold IPA.

mE720Vl5Ko5hXCW2Zb5JeQ.text: I love this place! Fun, casual atmosphere, sports bar-ish, but there is seating to eat separated from the bar. Fried pickles, blackened fish sandwich, burgers, everything I've had here has been delicious!

wMLUaaWY3mewxVBoORqyJg.text: The kids and I went here and enjoyed it very much.  One built his own burger, the other his own chicken wrap, and I got the meatloaf sandwich. The portions were tremendous and the service was very good, even though the place was quite crowded.  I won't be raving to everyone I meet, but it's a lovely option here in Mint Hill, so nice to have somewhere to go that isn't a chain, and we'll definitely be back.

jC_SNqK7q045pmofdiwQbw.text: This place was a nice surprise. If you're a fan of having a delicious burger or sandwich made exactly the way you want it, you can't go wrong grabbing lunch here. The wait staff was more than accommodating with the food and drinks as well as the 10 tv screens to split between the fans of various teams on a Sunday afternoon. We split a burger and a pizza flatbread and both were delicious, but the sweet potato tater tots were especially good. We also liked the emphasis they placed on beers brewed locally in various cities of NC.

QoKWDrXVY7f1HcOgHwEeOg.text: I would give a negative 2 if it would let me! Our party of 8 attempted to eat here tonight. We walk in and were never greeted. Young girls standing at the welcome podium chatting, messing with their phones and drinking their drinks. After 5 minutes one girl looks up and ask how many proceeds to tell us it is a 25 minute wait then takes off and didn't return for a bit. She didn't write us down. Another girl asked us how many then wrote us down. They kept seating tables of 2 instead of pushing two tables together at that point we had been waiting 25 minutes. We waited another 25 minutes and decided to leave. After cancelling our table two members of our party was still in the building talking to family members that are regulars there to over hear the waitstaff get told the 8 top decided to leave and the others to excitedly say thank goodness, i'm glad....hmmm I will never step foot in that door again. Someone missed out on a very nice tip....

vAZt7YEVhE5qJ4wh2vA_Ow.text: i'm not sure what these people are talking about with regard to portion sizes, but you get 1/2 pound of chicken tenders with fries (lots of them) for 7$. i do agree that the pricing is a bit steep and the food is bar-food TYPE food... but it is done well. the food isn't greasy or cold as it is at the Hill... what was this other person thinking suggesting the hill is better?! been to the hill many times and the food is gross, greasy, and the restaurant is dark, dingy, and the service is slow, at best. not saying dunwellz is a slam dunk... but they will get my business again, for sure!

8Lcue39qA_SM6UEEwOPGwg.text: I became interested in eating here, only because my bank offered me money back to do so.  So I thought what the heck, it's right around the corner from where you live try it.  So I did last Friday me and my family ate there, I got everything to go.  I wasn't that impressed by the food, like I thought I was going to be.  Me and my little girl enjoyed the carmel sauce that came with the apples she got with her meal it was very good.  My mom enjoyed her salad, I got the hamburger on texas toast with fries and some fried pickles.  I wasn't expecting the pickles to hot but they were, and that made me really upset. Any who, the burger well it was just ok nothing to shout about or be excited.  It was so good that the other half of it is still sitting in my refridgerator.   I hate that it wasn't that good because there aren't too many places to eat at around here.  I think that maybe I just ordered the wrong food, not sure if I will give it another try or not.

c9jGWQ2U39SGNySfym9BHA.text: Tried Dunwellz last night and the wings were absolutely the best wings I've had anywhere without driving 30 minutes out of your way. We normally eat wings at The Hill Grill,which are great wings, but the way Dunwellz prepares theirs were more of our taste, slighty smaller wing which fries up better and gives it a great taste.Lots of sauce selections, and the prices are more reasonable than any other place in the area.The onion rings were also good. Great drinks. Will definitely be going back to try one of the build your own burgers. They have great food and drink specials daily.

BN_4FDbKyTWEV_cBlCnYsg.text: We have tried this new, locally owned place 3 times now. The first time was shortly after they opened ,so we will excuse the bumps in the service-which was lack of service. We actually had to flag wait person down to ask to get service. Meanwhile the person I take to be the owner is standing at the end of the row of tables talking to friends. Finally order the food and are served. No problem with the food at all. Very tasty burgers & fries. Onion rings kind of weak.  Second trip everything is fine, good service, good food. The one problem was the delay in the charge card - husband put the tip on the card, but noticed the next morning when he checked his bank statement on line it didn't show the tip. Not wanting the server to think we didn't tip her, he went up later that day and gave her the tip. Of course, the next day the separate charge for the tip comes through. Oh well. Last night was the 3rd visit. Greeted at the door by 2 hostesses & taken to our table. And then we wait. And wait. And wait. We can count 8 servers millling around. We finally ask the hostess to send a waitress over. Once again food is fine. Interesting note is the owner actually came by the table to pick up an empty plate- never said a word to us. For a local place, I really would think speaking to your guests would go a long way in getting them to return. Training someone to be in charge of the floor and take notice of what's going on would help as well.  Would we return? Not really sure- there's a lot of good burger places out there that have good food, good service and really appreciate the fact that you choose to support their business.

8RIuAyhWn9CKYGUwuS9mng.text: Overpriced, limited selection, noisey, slow service. Did I mention overpriced. Go elsewhere and save your time and money.

Vqm9qyO_xy_Km2BWtQQBxA.text: The food was very good and there seems to be a lot of events that you can attend during the week like trivia. I was disappointed in the service as they were not busy at all and the waitstaff seemed to be taking a lunch break as well.

m13ln6tm2RxcsnowxyKP4Q.text: Dunwellz is a great thing to have in Mint Hill - since Mint Hill really doesn't have a lot. The food is acceptable, the beer selection is great (plenty of craft beers and regular specials on those too), and the atmosphere is pretty comfy.   Trivia is Tuesdays there, started at about 7.45pm when I went, and it was crowded! Get there early if you want a table during trivia, since it's not that big of a restaurant. Trivia is great there, questions were a good mix of pop culture and actually important stuff - ;) - and the host is nice. All kinds of prize opportunities throughout the game, but it does seem to get pretty competitive.

egxAX9H7RqulDBSWt7ECXw.text: I absolutely love this place. Has a great variety of foods that are all great. Burgers are creative and delicious. Since moving to the Mint Hill area this has definitely been a favorite. Also has great drink specials, you can't go wrong with this place!

Zq1romfqgATX9UM4N-e0yw.text: Attended a fundraising event and had a great time. Definitely will go back and enjoy more of all they have to offer.

I-YwV9Wj548g3yl4c7XP8g.text: I really like this place.  I've watched a few football games here and the environment and service is great.    They have good bar food on their menu and even include gluten free choices.  For the record their turkey is amazing.    This is a place I recommend for watching sporting events, or kicking back and having a drink in a very laid back atmosphere.

iA3q7ChfSLUr3cQ4yLWifw.text: Food is really good. The service is excellent.  However this place is really BRIGHT.  All the lights are on and bright no matter what time of day it is. My wife and I came in at 11pm for a couple beers.  All the lights  were still on. At some point most bars turn down their lights after the dinner rush.  I wish they would start doing this.  Besides that, I really like the place.

0pjXyKuQKlRuRAMtYpKbhQ.text: AMAZING FOOD!! Great service people are so sweet. Fun atmosphere. My friend and I split the Notorious PIG and fried Oreos...both are a must on one of your visits. We will definitely be going back, overall really great place.

7m36M5iVO9TJt4ykaRJNBA.text: This was pretty good.  There is a huge selection on the menu. We started with fried pickles, which were excellent. The one glitch was I ordered a medium hamburger, and it was overdone. But, it was still pretty good, just not perfect. The topping choices were many and tasted good.  The salad was perfect as were the fries.  We will be back!

zfgdY5bit_fG5FDS1M1ZNg.text: Can't imagine spending my Monday nights anywhere else! The great deals they offer each night of the week. Monday night= wing night. Each wing was made soulfully, and wonderfully! Very impressed with the staff, customer service, food quality, price, and overall experience. Many options to chose from; however, if you are going for the first time, their soups and wings are great starters! A major plus is all the TV's for sports! Monday Night Football is best spent at Dunwellz!

q_VT_K1VZMvxoH3Q_yBGaA.text: Nice staff. Food is only average. Burgers are safe bet and Wings are good but small. The bar is well stocked and Trivia Night is fun.

pfl6bxRGKCRVv7hmQXmsWA.text: All I can say is Mint Hill needs more of places like this.  I don't always need fancy shmancy places to eat and drink.  When I'm off that kick, this is the kind of joint I like.  They let you make your own burger and they have a decent tap selection.    Combine all that with service and a smile then I'm a happy camper.  Dunwellz did well in my book!  You just don't want to walk in expecting anything more than a local hangout that has staple bar food.  Do that and you too will like it.

3_G405Ws05aR3Hs8wZhWvw.text: Friggin' spectacular donut burger. The sweet potato tots seemed of the frozen variety, but still decent with the cinnamon butter. Clean facility, friendly staff. Overall great experience. Will definitely go back!!

n7dkkmJg324WkyrBvZxwiA.text: Thursday night in Mint Hill means wings. Should you go to Dunwellz or The Hill Grill just down the road? It's very simple. Dunwellz has a better beer selection and cheaper wings. The grill has better wings, a decent beer selection, but a much better atmosphere (unless heavy metal is your thing). Winner: The Hill.

wyADBpPioj1WN-2hS7bJmQ.text: Wow tough crowd out here in ole Mint Hill...? I mean seriously folks, this place is new and working out its kinks. Not to mention, you've got very few options out here so I would've thought this place to be pretty popular.   Beer, Food, Games, Patio, Clean...  *scratches head*  Oh Well, It was a good find for me while staying close by so call me a Fan!  I ordered the Fish and Chips that were pretty dang good The fish meat was super tender white and juicy, the crust had a nice thin layer of crisp bread and the server knew that the dish goes well with Malt Vinegar.  While I can't vouch for all their food my fish and chips were grade A.  Peace.

S5V7K_ynlSBoBWHgkcXeLw.text: Food was just ok here. I got the turkey Reuben which was decent but the fries were awesome. Drink specials were relatively non existent even on a Sunday and the atmosphere was kinda gross. So loud I couldn't hear who I was sitting with (music sucked anyway) and the decor was pretty "dinerish". I really wanted to sit at an outside table but a bunch of people were sitting on tables smoking (so disappointed ugh). I guess I was expecting something a little more classy??

UKen1NK804o2dZB2O_lX3A.text: Fabulous soup, great beer selection and delicious fried Oreos. The staff is always friendly and service is good.

p6cdubiiLsr0vqu67XPwsg.text: Pretty good for our first time....We ordered our food to-go so we don't get the dine in experience. I think if we actually ate there the food may have been better, BUT the food still taste good. Our appetizers and fries were our favorite. My husband wasn't a fan of the chicken flavors he had chosen and I prefer my quesadillas with peppers and alot of cheese. If we had eaten inside our experience may have been a tad different.

5oX3TXYiO4llzT72hZ7k3w.text: Dunwellz reminds me of that episode of Southpark where they had a restaurant called Raisins ... it was ran by kids and all the customers were kids... it's sad that you try to enjoy your night out on a Friday at 12 at night and literally the whole place is filled with high school kids... I won't be stepping back in this place until they make some rules about allowing kids after hours... shame

zWYnfyqWG_CZj1TYOQm5Tw.text: We just walked out after being seated for 15 minutes, and no one taking our order. We've been twice before. Every time the service has been slow, but nothing like today. Every time the waitresses have been standing over by the drink station talking while leaving customers waiting. When the left today the hostess who sat us didn't say a word. It's a shame they are so unprofessional, becacuse the food is actually good. They clearly don't care if they have customers or make money. The place is always only a third to a half full, but they can't actually serve the people trying to eat there.  EDIT: 1/16/13: We gave this place another try, and it was much better the second time. Have been back several times since with no issues. The food is very good.

IYoTok12plX8EC8Q2ZjBmg.text: A new hang-out in Mint Hill (with their opening, you now need 2 hands to count the local offerings!). We went early one evening to check them out.  On a Tuesday evening, they were packed (again, minimal choices locally). Luckily it was a nice evening, since the patio were their only seats. It is secluded, away from the parking lot and other traffic. There are a couple corn-hole sets to go with their picnic table seats. The hostess and server were very nice.  The food is OK. It wasn't abysmal, but I'm not counting down the days to go back, either. Typical bar food, though I was expecting everything to be a dollar or two less than it is.   They have a small, but decent, beer list as well as a few wines and mixed drinks.   They'll be a great option in the area when I want to go out for a beer but don't want to drive to University or South End.

1rqSNlgp5WKnj8gpNzm7zA.text: Fantastic food and staff. Great food selection and always consistent. Largest selection of IPA's around and everything is always speedy.

bvHCc7-DgByoPbanFn6JJA.text: Hit and miss on service. Food is always good, but service has its ups and downs. I have recently walked out while waiting on seating while watching the waitstaff huddle and giggle at the hostess stand and outside the kitchen. After this last visit we left early due to the outside seating being the place where everyone goes to smoke and compares f word enunciation's in front of my 3 kids. The waitress apologized. Like I said the food is always good! You must try the notorious PIG! And take out is always on point if you call ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Seasonal bottle 3$ dark but very sweet. Decent but filling.
Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Notorious P.I.G.

o7Mq1Xky61oj8MzUlCxB5g.text: Who wears Short Shorts? They do @ Dunwellz! Great job Ladies!

ydiNB3F_xV-7tucIHpR3vg.text: Great food, great service, great selection of craft beer! Highly recommend this place.

u9nVw9Qlgnuso2gt5VA5FA.text: Eaten here a few times but probably not again. Food wasn't bad but not exceptional. Burgers are ok. Shrimp po boy - not worth the money. Chaotic atmosphere.

1_O1LhcabfaabTsscIrHTw.text: My wife and I along w/ my 2 little boys recently went to Dunwellz.  As we entered the restaurant the hostess told us we can sit anywhere. So being that we have two little ones and don't want to disturb others we took a corner table in the back.  The 1st issue was we waited over 10 minutes just for someone to take our drink order.  Not for beer or soda, just to get water.  As the waitress approached our table she appeared that she was not happy to see us sitting in her section as she rolled her eyes and gave us the "look".  Once the waitress took our order, she was back in about 5 minutes w/ our drinks which is OK since the restaurant was starting to fill up around 1pm.  We placed our order (wife ordered Mushroom Swiss Burger & I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich).  My wife however asked that instead of Swiss Cheese they add American cheese.  Pretty simple request I thought.  20 minutes later food came.  We were starving and ready to enjoy our lunch and of course my wife's' burger had Swiss cheese instead of American.  Now, if this was the 1st time, honest mistake, I can accept that, but this was the 2nd time the kitchen made my wife's burger incorrect.  We had been there a couple of weeks earlier ordering the same things.  So, both waitresses both times confirmed they keyed American cheese into the POS and they confirmed it with the receipt so shame on the kitchen staff for not getting this right.  So the waitress took the burger back and then within a minute the burger came back w/ American cheese, but you could clearly see that all they did was scrap off the swiss (which by the way there was still little bit on there) and then they placed a cold piece of american cheese on the burger.  So my wife now had to eat a semi warm burger that has been handled multiple times w/ a cold piece of american cheese, gross!   The other thing that was very annoying is our waitress was not attentive at all and I had to flag her down at least 4-5 times for another beer, clean up and the check. The waitresses were huddled together by the soda machine checking their cell phones and talking.  Don't get me wrong, the food is good, I enjoy the vast selection of craft beers, but if I was a new comer and had this experience I would assume Dunwellz wait staff and kitchen staff pays no attention to detail and also doesn't wait to pay attention to families w/ little kids.

EGQJJZ8oijtpqxBohQId6A.text: Sat at the bar, bartender was very attentive without being annoying.  On one hand, the beer selection is good - for example, 4 of 5 taps are local and that is awesome.  On the downside, all of the beers were very, very safe choices and nothing that stood out.  Ordered a burger and got chips instead of fries.  Chips were OK but I did wonder how old the oil was.  Burger was on the VERY RARE side of "Medium Rare", I just know some of the times I have requested medium at other establishments it gets cooked all the way through.  This one was still mooing but it was tasty all the same.  I forgot my wallet, but thankfully have memorized a credit card number - not sure how that would have worked out...I'd probably still be there washing dishes! I will give a different dish a try next time, hopefully they will work on improving their beer selection.

xt6aRARY7gputeu6V0KgqQ.text: Would love to give Dunwellz 4 or even 5 stars just because of the outstanding food and wait staff but beware if you happen to want to sit outside on the patio to enjoy a meal. The " regulars " are normally out there partaking in shots and smoking cigarettes while engaging in deep, philosophical discussions that include numerous variants of The ' F ' word. Went there recently on a Sunday ( their advertised " Sunday Kids Day " ) and the regulars were out there while at least two other families were out on the patio with children and had to hear the filthy language. I mentioned this to one of the wait staff and finally said something to one of the gentlemen but my wife told me to not start any trouble. Seems to me that whomever is bartending at the time should have cut them off after about their 4th shot.

xxYanQNjRFXXng3vCrxUQQ.text: Our family is new to the area and we love Dunwellz.  I am not sure of any other restaurant that I regularly go to in which I choose so many different items on the menu.  I love the Hawaiian Chicken sandwich with the sweet potato tater tots and cinnamon butter dip.  The brisket grilled cheese sandwich is fantastic and on nights they have the tomato basil soup is a perfect combo.  The family loves the wings or Queso for an appetizer.   Trivia night is always fun for the family.  The staff is wonderful and do a great job turning tables to accommodate you pretty quickly on a busy night.

Cjn2PGjtHJM7FsVb_25z-A.text: I'm surprised at the negative reviews for poor service, we saw nothing but attentive servers when we went for lunch.   I can't comment on the beer selections, we don't drink, but my Diet Coke was very refreshing. We went because I heard from a friend that they had a diverse menu, which they do.   We started with a yummy southwest egg roll app served with a chipotle ranch dipping sauce. A little too spicy for my 14 year old, but Alina and I enjoyed them. Alex ordered the make your  own burger, which she said was very tasty. She also had a side of baked potato soup, which she liked even more than her burger. Alina ordered the make your own fish sandwich, which was way too big for her to finish. Alina really liked the potato bun, it went great with the crunchy fish filet. I ordered the 1/2 lb chicken tenders app as my meal. I asked for a side of bbq sauce, and guess what? It arrived with the meal, I didn't have to send the server back to get it. The tenders were small, but abundant. I'm a big guy, but I couldn't finish the fries. Oh, I finished the tenders, no worries there. I was very happy with my menu choice, it was great.  If I had to find 1 con, it was that lunch for 3 with only 2 sodas came to $41, a little pricey for lunch. If we are ever back in Mint Hill, we will definitely return for another great meal.

YzVZ1rdoTr9HboQE1-W0fw.text: This is a great neighborhood spot. The wings and the burgers are top notch. Well, everything. Lol! The specials and the games and activities are fun. I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars because takeout has issues. I can honestly say there is usually an issue when you pick up.  Check your order. They are amazing when you catch it, though. Top notch customer service - you just have to wait for your order to be remade but it is usually with a free soda and if really botch they will give you a discount. I tried the online ordering but got caught in a glitch where I could not select all flappers AND fried, then grilled. Love this place, tho.

o-7HK9Kfir8MVdStX4X_4Q.text: I decided to stop in for lunch and check out this place to see what it was all about. The rumor was that it was going to be a type of build your burger joint and for once the rumors were pretty spot on. While the food itself is kinda what I would call on the level with "bar food" (ie burgers, wings, etc) it is all very well prepared. There wasn't one hiccup in either my order or the food itself which it seems like a lot of times when you try new places they usually tend to mess something up. Not the case here which imo goes to show they know what they are doing.   For lunch I had some chips and queso for a app and the queso was kind of standard but the chips themselves were more of a high quality restaurant style which were served piping hot and tasted awesome. I followed that up with a Turkey burger and some sweet potato tots. The patty on the turkey burger was seasoned extremely well and tasted delicious. The sweet potato tots were top notch and served with a honey cinnamon dip that complemented them very well. The one thing that I gotta say that was cool about the burgers is that they let you choose multiple toppings and don't nickle and dime you to death on the price for each additional item. I think it's like 50 cents extra for chili but all the standard stuff is gratis which is awesome.   The only one down side I can say about the place is that they had country music as a static background. It fits the place well but seeing how I personally hate country music I just had to suffer through it with the meal but that didn't detract from the excellent service or food at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. Beer cooler
Photo of Dunwellz - Mint Hill, NC, United States. I think the chill the glasses  all the way down close to absolute zero.

2YO4kq0rddMde6s5wMqh4w.text: Dunwellz is a relaxed family friendly place. We really like the wings and burgers. The staff is always nice and friendly.

xNzgwUDyUJMKOKJP4LvZdQ.text: Very tasty food great service,fair pricing. A little loud for our liking but will certainly be going back.

EwelRYJwe8MeY7h6Q3cD8w.text: Great wings, burgers and salads! Always a good time for daddy-daughter chicken wings Saturday afternoons!

B1200_1nHjAKXFI5TuAFog.text: I'm giving this place 5 big ones because everything was great! Took my buddy there on his birthday for lunch. Got there about 12:30 was fairly busy but no problem getting a table.  Owner greeted us and was on staff the whole time making all run smoothly.  Wait staff was friendly and hard working.  Started out with a bacon Bloody Mary and fried pickles.......both tasted great. I posted a picture that shows the bacon in the drink....oh yeah....I ate it. I got the meatloaf burger. I could have built my own from a large assortment of items on the menu, a great idea and I can't believe they keep this much stuff in stock. I'm talking all kind of breads, cheese, toppings etc. I decided to go with a salad for my side and was surprised when our waitress asked what kind of lettuce I would like.....wait...what? Awesome and fresh. Now I read some other reviews before I went in today and I have to disagree with the folks that said this food was just ok, it's way better than that. Staff is friendly and on point. Food is hot, fresh and delish. I will go again..........soon I hope

4j5gWgbIfO1x3oc8GTSImw.text: Love to come here when I am in town for work. Service is great and the food is amazing. All the way from appetizer to dessert are amazing I highly suggest you stop in for the food and casual environment.

podKVffbAW64ViAt4vKCwQ.text: I've been coming to dunwellz for years since I've worked in the same shopping center. It was the local hang out spot for me and my friends and co workers to hang out after work. However, we have stopped coming here as much and every time we do we decide to probably not to come back again bc THEIR SERVICE SUCKS!!!! waitresses are rude and slow whether they are busy or slow. Can't even bring me the water I ordered. The bartenders only focus on regulars at the bar, and distant themselves from other at tables. It's very apparent that they are solely focused on guaranteed tips instead of helping others, and it's absolutely terrible. I stood at the bar not waiting for a drink, but waiting to even get asked if I've been helped or would I like to order, ALL THREE bartenders passed me by for over 15 minutes even when I tried getting their attention to order and I still got nothing. So I said oh well and left. I ended up getting drinks from the gas station and went home. This is how local places like this lose business and eventually close down. I don't think I'm gonna come back at all, and I'm gonna tell all my customers that come to my store in the same shopping center not to either!

dlJ-lakJm7jUkg9IDVQJ_g.text: Went here for the first time last night and didn't know they where doing 60 cent wing and boy was they good the bartender was great I think his name was nick but I will be going back to this place
